body: I think that my problem is related to this issue. Can't run my app on Electron 0.36.0 because the renderer-process crashes instantly after rendering its first frame. Works fine on Electron 0.35.x

Still seeing a crash post-fix :( 


@paulcbetts Can you make sure you have updated the libchromiumcontent binaries? You need to run the `script/bootstrap.py` to update them.

**Edit:** Ignore that, I just saw the crash again.

issue.title: [0.36.0] reading large files failed

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
When trying to read in files into an Electron application (pdf documents, stored in local PouchDB (leveldb)) using the File object I will experience a crash of the application with the latest version of the Electron runtime (0.36.0). Using an earlier version of it works pretty well with the same file though...

On the command line I see the following "crash dump" before the application quits unexpectedly:

[10084:10156:1211/152921:VERBOSE1:crash_service_main.cc(68)] Session start. cmdline is [--reporter-url=http://54.249.141.255:1127/post --app
lication-name=inspect.demonstrator --v=1]

issue.title: Electron Mac OSX crash render when write file too fast

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

body: Looks like this is fixed with Atom
Does this bug [when fixed and validated] alone deserve to cause a new minor version of electron being released?
@ducky427 I think so, because of this bug electron completely crashes when it's writing files in my application.
